Flow Control¶

Let’s start by syntax changes, basically, instead of indenting and : use () and {}, so this:

if expression:
    do whatever

becomes:

if(expression){
    do whatever
}

there is no need for indenting there of-course. Either separate lines by a \n (new line) character, or by a ;, they’re equivalent in Brackets:

line one; line two; line ...;

for example you can write:

if(expression) {
   print("Hello world!"); print("Brackets are awesome!")
}

so that’s that, there’s the same syntax for other stuff too:

if(expression) {
   whatever...
} elif (other thingy) {
   do other whatever!
} else {
   oh well nothing matched?
}

the same syntax for for and while:

while(expression) {
   what should be looped?
}

for(whatever) {
   do something to whatever
}

same simple syntax for with, try and except:

with (open(file) as f) {
   do something to this file
}

and to catch exceptions:

try {
   something
} except {
   oh something went wrong!
}

try {
   some other thing
}
except (thatException) {
   oh wow it failed because thatException!
}
